meanings.definition: Regard someone or something as unworthy of respect or approval.
meanings.sent1: She disesteems his actions and refuses to speak to him.
meanings.sent2: The teacher disesteems cheating and always gives failing grades to those caught.
meanings.sent3: The cat disesteems the new brand of food and refuses to eat it.
meanings.sent4: His arrogant behavior disesteems him in the eyes of his peers.
meanings.sent5: The company's decision to cut corners disesteems their reputation in the industry.

meanings.definition: Have a low opinion of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: He disesteems the new policy and believes it will lead to chaos.
meanings.sent2: She disesteems gossiping and prefers to focus on positive conversations.
meanings.sent3: The toddler disesteems vegetables and always finds a way to avoid eating them.
meanings.sent4: The artist disesteems traditional techniques and seeks to innovate in her work.
meanings.sent5: His critical nature disesteems even the smallest mistakes made by others.
